protocol.text: For the microarray analysis, fully expanded leaf samples from 4 randomly collected plants per species were harvested at 4 physiological states as determined from prior gas exchange measurements (growth temperature - baseline, photosynthetic optimum, 20% inhibition of optimum and 30% inhibition of optimum). The temperature response curves were created by increasing temperature step-wise (2 °C per 10 mins) from 22 to 42 °C to the desired physiological state and waiting 20-30 mins for photosynthesis to stabilize before sampling. Each curve took 3-4 h to complete.

Seeds of Arabidopsis thaliana (ecotype Col-0) were imbibed at 4 °C with distilled water for 4d to facilitate uniform germination.  The seeds were resuspended in 0.05% agarose after the cold treatment and planted in pots containing Fafard 3B mix (Conrad Fafard, Agawam, MA).  Plants were grown in a Conviron BDW80 walk-in growth chamber under the following growth conditions: 22 °C, 60% relative humidity, a 10 h photoperiod, and 350 μmol m-2s-1 light intensity. Plants were watered as needed and fertilized weekly using 125 ppm N of Jack's Professional

Total RNA was isolated from 100 mg of tissue using an RNeasy® Mini Kit (Qiagen Inc., CA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.  An on-column DNase 1 treatment (Sigma-Aldrich) was used during RNA extraction to remove any potential genomic DNA contamination.
Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 6 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
Following fragmentation, cRNA was hybridized to the ATH1 Affymetrix slide according to standard protocols (#PM702232; www.affymetrix.com).
GeneChips were scanned using the GeneChip Scanner 3000 according to standard protocol #PM702232; www.affymetrix.com.

All data were analyzed using the limma package in the Bioconductor software (v.2.4). Gene level information for RMA normalized expression values are presented within the matrix for all samples analyzed.
